sub_title: Time flies when I am creating solutions using data and technology to deal with social and environmental issues
summary:
Sustainability Engineer with 4+ years of experience managing the mitigation of potential biological, physical and social impacts caused by industrial, commercial and residential developments. An enthusiast of the science of flood hazard and climate change, participating in two important climate adaptation projects for metropolitan coastal cities. 

My goal is to see lives changed through my work. That's where I get my motivation from.   

• Promoted the sustainable installation and operation of more than 40 potentially impacting
projects, ranging from chemical industries to residential developments

• Contributed to the future resiliency of two important metropolitan coastal cities by joining the hazard assessment team of two distinct flood management projects

• Took ownership of several environmental impact reports, increasing the scope of studies offered by
Global Ambiente Environmental Consultancy by 15%

• A key player in the 30% revenue growth rate of a startup over 4 years by taking ownership of previously outsourced environmental impact studies

• Successfully designed a stress test protocol for a climate adaptation project, based upon a thorough analysis of past and future modelled climate data

I get excited about opportunities that aim to directly or indirectly cause a positive impact in other peoples lives, specifically in the world of water management and climate change. Want to connect? Feel free to email me at caue.u.castro@gmail.com

projects.title: Predicting car accident severity using a multivariate logistic regression model
projects.description:
The city’s department of transportation, along with the budget office, would be the main target audience to be convinced that the project is worth to be invested in. 
Enhancing awareness is proven to be directly correlated with a decrease in the number of accidents. However, some types of awareness messages are more effective than others. Usually, general statements – such as: “Fast driving kills” – are not as effective as when real statistics are attached to it – like: “Driving above speed limit causes 50% more severe accidents – where the person reading it can make a better sense of the risks involved though quantitative information. 
With that in mind, the project involved downloading a traffic accident dataset for the city of Seattle, group it by different degrees of severity (e.g. fatality, serious injury, injury, prop damage) and apply a classification supervised model - Logistic Regression - to make predictions to categorical target label and further calculate the probability of a certain category to happen. 
The dataset was download from the Department of Transportation of the city of Seattle, under ArcGIS Metadata Form.
Three different evaluation algorithms were used in order to assess the accuracy of the results obtained by the Logistic Regression model: Jaccard Index, F1 Score and Log Loss.

projects.title: Climate stress test protocol for flood risk mitigation in Guayaquil, Ecuador
projects.description:
Outline
Designed a climate stress test protocol for a flood risk mitigation project carried out for the city of Guayaquil, Ecuador. 
Key responsibilities
- Collected and analyzed data related to the local multiple natural hazard events - sea level rise, high tide and short and long-duration extreme rainfall - and its interactions.
- Gathered climate change data from different CGMs and RCMs
- Provided data and guidance to the modellers
- Held several meetings with a multinational team of stakeholders

contributors.headline: Time flies when I am creating solutions using data and technology to deal with social and environmental issues

projects.title: Retrieving street flooding hotspots in urban landscape using free data sources
projects.description:
Outline
Contribute with the hazard risk assessment stage of the “Anticipatory Flood Management in Alexandria, Egypt” project that aims at significantly reduce the impact of flooding caused both by storm surge and extreme rainfall
Key responsibilities
- Set up a hydrologic-hydraulic model for a densely built up region of the city
- Researched different techniques to acquire data in data scarce regions
- Built partnerships with different remote sensing data providers
- Collected and analyzed remote sensing flood data
- Developed an interactive map and an survey to collect first-party data from social media platforms  
- Comprised and assessed the data collected

profile_positions.description:
- Reach alignment across those various teams on data availability, data quality, and data analysis for the Annual Certification Reports of 2022

- Support the Tailored program team in creating Monthly reports focusing on one specific crop, using Power Bi and Excel skills

to align stakeholder business intelligence outputs with RA’s data management, governance and security policies and procedures,

profile_positions.title: Senior Associate Business Intelligence

profile_positions.description:

profile_positions.title: Data Analyst (GIS)

profile_positions.description:
• Keep track of incoming, in production, and outgoing parts utilizing real-time data reports (Crystal Reports)
• Solve inventory discrepancies on the spot through problem-solving skills, preventing delay and revenue loss
• Sustain high-level of focus and attention to detail during the cycle counts

profile_positions.title: Inventory Control Auditor

profile_positions.description:
• Analyzed historic ground climate data and future GCM/RCM data utilizing Python and MS Excel, reaching the desired results to design a climate stress test protocol 
• Collected and analyzed data of multiple natural hazard events - e.g. sea-level rise, high tide and short and long-duration extreme rainfall - and its interactions. 
• Extensively used complex data visualization methods and statistical techniques - e.g. Regression Analysis, frequency distributions, IDF curve, alternating block method - to extract robust results from the data
• Successfully translated the data into actionable insights, enabling the stakeholders to take better-informed decision-making regarding flood-proof structural investments
